message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper focuses on studying the performance and behavior of BERT in ranking tasks, specifically in MS MARCO passage reranking and TREC Web Track ad hoc document ranking. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper leverages pre-trained BERT and fine-tunes it, which falls under the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also explores the attention allocation and matching patterns of BERT, which are relevant to Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-categories.
